Key Match Events: Washington Sundar’s three wickets have restricted Zimbabwe to 159/6 helping India win by 23 runs in the third of five match T20I series at the Harare Sports Club in Harare on Wednesday.
Pre-Game Insights: Shubman Gill's half-century combined with cameos from Ruturaj Gaikwad and Yashasvi Jaiswal helped India to reach 182/4 after India won the toss and opted to bat first.

Sikandar Raza’s men have been let down by their basics like fielding and executing their lengths and more importantly basic tactical errors from Sikandar Raza like not using Muzarambani with the new ball and going for spinners.
Post-Match Reflections: That's it. It would leave a bittersweet taste in the mouths of Indian players here. After the first six overs they would have hoped to clean out Zimbabwe but it was a resilient performance from Myers to take them to 159 yes India is a batter short but it is a warning sign for them going forward into the next game.
With the win India led the five-match T20I series 2-1 with the fourth and fifth T20Is scheduled for Saturday and Sunday in Harare.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain delays led to the game being postponed until the next day.
